meanings.definition: To perform music or entertainment in a public place for donations.
meanings.sent1: She busks on the street corner to earn money.
meanings.sent2: The musician busks in the park every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The clown busks with juggling acts and funny tricks.
meanings.sent4: The magician busks his way into the hearts of the audience.
meanings.sent5: Busking under the bright lights, she captivates the passersby with her guitar.

meanings.definition: A strip of rigid material used to stiffen the front of a corset.
meanings.sent1: The dressmaker added a busk to the corset for support.
meanings.sent2: The vintage corset featured an intricate busk design.
meanings.sent3: The busk in the corset made the wearer stand up straight.
meanings.sent4: The busk in the corset was like a backbone, keeping everything in place.
meanings.sent5: The busk in the corset creaked softly as she moved, a reminder of its presence.
